definition: to slacken off in one's work/to go slow (as a form of strike)

sentences.english: COMMUNICATION Go slow and don t try to share every tidbit of information about yourself over night.
sentences.chinese: 通訊怠工和頓河筆嘗試分享自己的資料每粒一夜之間。

sentences.english: We should punish all of the saboteurs.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當處罰所有怠工者。

sentences.english: Busy though you may be, that's no excuse for slacking on body care.
sentences.chinese: 雖然你可以忙，那是沒有理由消極怠工的身體保健。

sentences.english: Mr Chá vez denounced the strikers as saboteurs and sacked them all.
sentences.chinese: 查韋斯抨擊罷工人士是怠工者，全數解僱。

definition: more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to abscond/to be absent without leave
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
